org.frustra.filament

Class FilamentClassLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • java.security.SecureClassLoader
        • java.net.URLClassLoader
          • org.frustra.filament.FilamentClassLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class FilamentClassLoader
extends URLClassLoader
    FilamentClassLoader is the URLClassLoader used by filament when hooking and injecting classes. It is also used for managing resources associated with those classes.

    FilamentClassLoader creates a global Filament instance, which contains all the hooks, injectors, and classes loaded into it. There can only be one instance of FilamentClassLoader defined per application.

    An example program using filament could consist of: 

         loader = new FilamentClassLoader(true);
     loader.loadPackage("org.frustra.example.target");
     Thread.currentThread().setContextClassLoader(loader);
 
     Hooking.loadHooks("org.frustra.example.hooks");
     Injection.loadInjectors("org.frustra.example.injectors");
 
     Class cls = loader.loadClass("org.frustra.example.target.Main");
     Method entryPoint = cls.getDeclaredMethod("main", new Class[] { String[].class });
     entryPoint.invoke(null, new Object[] { new String[0] });
    See Also:
    Hooks, Injection

    • Method Detail

      • loadJar

        public final void loadJar(File jarFile)
                   throws IOException
        Load the contents of a jar into the filament class loader so that they can be hooked and injected.
        Parameters:
        jarFile - a jar to be loaded
        Throws:
        IOException - if the jar couldn't be loaded

      • loadJar

        public final void loadJar(JarFile jar,
           URL url)
                   throws IOException
        Load the contents of a jar into the filament class loader so that they can be hooked and injected.

        If the url argument is null, only classes will be loaded. This means other resources won't be available through the class loader.

        Parameters:
        jar - a JarFile to be loaded
        url - the URL that the JarFile was loaded from
        Throws:
        IOException - if the jar couldn't be loaded

      • loadPackage

        public final void loadPackage(String packageName)
                       throws IOException,
                              ClassNotFoundException
        Load the classes contained within a package into the filament class loader so that they can be hooked and injected.
        Parameters:
        packageName - a String representing the name of a package
        Throws:
        IOException - if a class can't be read
        ClassNotFoundException - if the package couldn't be resolved

        Parameters:
        classes - an array of classes to be loaded
        Throws:

      • getClassBytes

        public final byte[] getClassBytes(String name)
        Get the bytes representing a class. If the class has relevant injectors, they will be run on the class.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of a class
        Returns:
        a byte array representing the class

      • getResourceFromBytes

        public URL getResourceFromBytes(String name,
                       byte[] buf)
        Gets the URL associated with a resource. The resource does not have to exist as an actual file on the system, for example classes returned by getClassBytes(name).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the resource
        buf - the bytes defining the resource
        Returns:
        a URL that can be used to read the resource
